title: Add serve verdict handling to CC /run path
description:
The Claude Code path in run.md.template (Step 3) invokes serve but never checks the SERVE_RESULT verdict. It proceeds directly to Step 4 (tidy) regardless.

The OpenCode path correctly checks SERVE_RESULT and has a rework loop with up to 3 attempts.

Meanwhile, serve itself says: "Do NOT continue to tidy" (on NEEDS_CHANGES).

Fix: Add explicit SERVE_RESULT verdict handling to the CC /run path, matching OpenCode's structure.

Files: core/templates/commands/run.md.template (lines 83-91 CC path)

title: Move epic closure from tidy to close-service
description:
Tidy Step 4 (tidy.md.template:245-287) runs bd epic close-eligible and then merges the epic branch to main. This bypasses close-service entirely -- no E2E validation, no critic review, no acceptance documentation.

Fix:
1. Tidy: Remove epic closure and branch merge logic. Replace with detection + suggestion to run close-service.
2. Close-service: Add branch merge logic after epic validation passes.
3. Run Step 5: Already correctly delegates to close-service, so no change needed there.

Files: 
- core/templates/commands/tidy.md.template (Step 4)
- core/templates/commands/close-service.md.template (add Step 8.5 for branch merge)

title: Reverse serve order to sous-chef then polisher
description:
Currently serve runs polisher (Edit access) before sous-chef (read-only reviewer). This creates attribution loss, anchoring bias, and no rollback path.

Fix (Option A from analysis): Reverse to sous-chef→polisher:
1. Sous-chef reviews the original developer code → produces verdict + issues
2. If APPROVED: polisher refines for clarity → changes go in a separate commit
3. If NEEDS_CHANGES: send back to cook (no polish needed on code that needs rework)

Files: core/templates/commands/serve.md.template (Steps 2-3)

title: Standardize verdict vocabulary across agents
description:
Current verdict vocabulary is inconsistent:
- sous-chef: ready_for_tidy | needs_changes | blocked (lowercase_snake)
- SERVE_RESULT: APPROVED | NEEDS_CHANGES | BLOCKED (UPPER_CASE)
- taster: APPROVED | APPROVED WITH NOTES | REJECTED
- maitre: APPROVED | NEEDS CHANGES | BLOCKED
- critic: PASS | NEEDS_WORK | FAIL

Fix: Standardize sous-chef to use APPROVED | NEEDS_CHANGES | BLOCKED to match SERVE_RESULT.

Files:
- core/templates/agents/sous-chef.md.template
- core/templates/commands/serve.md.template (document mapping)

title: Fix cook-to-tidy finding transfer and in-progress triage
description:
Two P2 fixes:

1. Cook-to-tidy finding transfer fragile: Tidy Step 2 says "Review findings from cook and serve" but doesn't tell the agent to read bead comments. In multi-session work with /clear, findings survive only in bead comments.
Fix: Tidy Step 2 should explicitly say to read bead comments (bd comments show <id>) for PHASE: COOK and PHASE: SERVE findings.

2. In-progress triage too discretionary: Tidy Step 3 says "If task appears complete based on git changes, close it. Do NOT ask the user." This is too much discretion for a non-interactive command.
Fix: Only close the current task (the one that was just cooked). Leave other in-progress tasks as-is with a note.

Files: core/templates/commands/tidy.md.template (Steps 2-3)
